intro: Senecio moritzianus, commonly known as Moritz's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are generally narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Senecio moritzianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
